holidays.name: International Talk Like a Pirate Day
holidays.description: Arrr matey! On this day, people worldwide embrace their inner pirate by talking like swashbuckling buccaneers.
holidays.origin: Created in 1995 by friends John Baur and Mark Summers as a way to have fun on an otherwise ordinary day.
holidays.funFact: This quirky holiday has inspired special pirate-themed events, bar specials, and Wikipedia even sees a huge spike in pirate-related searches.

holidays.name: National Daiquiri Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the classic rum cocktail invented in Cuba. It's a perfect excuse to enjoy a refreshing daiquiri!
holidays.origin: Named for the Daiquiri cocktail, which was popularized during the early 1900s, especially by American expats in Cuba.
holidays.funFact: The daiquiri was a favorite drink of Ernest Hemingway, who famously enjoyed it at El Floridita bar in Havana.
